title: How to Look Androgynous: Fashion & Style Tips

steps.title: Stick with greyscale colors.
steps.content: Stick with greyscale colors. A truly gender-bending look relies heavily on black, white, and shades of gray. While the occasional splash of color can amp up your look, you should typically stick with more neutral tones. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Wear loose bottoms for a comfortable, masculine vibe.
steps.content: Wear loose bottoms for a comfortable, masculine vibe. Tight pants will show off your curves and feminine figure, which is the opposite of what the androgynous look is about. Stick with pants that are a bit less fitted. Boyfriend jeans are a nice option and look great paired with a t-shirt and cardigan. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pick an oversized shirt to downplay your feminine figure.
steps.content: Pick an oversized shirt to downplay your feminine figure. Gruber recommends looking for oversized shirts. If you’re shopping in the women’s section, look for “boyfriend” cuts. A loose top will hide your figure better than something super-fitted. Get a few men’s button-up shirts in a variety of colors or prints so that you can mix and match them with various bottoms. Try wearing a simple white button-up under a cardigan with a pair of boyfriend jeans and canvas sneakers.

steps.title: Choose a boat-necked top to broaden your shoulders.
steps.content: Choose a boat-necked top to broaden your shoulders. As far as necklines go, a boat neck top is perfect for the androgynous look as it is a mix of masculine and feminine. It makes your shoulders look wider and your neck shorter and more masculine to balance feminine features. [3] X Research source Pair a printed boat-neck top with corduroy pants and oxfords for a chic androgynous style.

steps.title: Wear a vest to add a classic menswear vibe to any outfit.
steps.content: Wear a vest to add a classic menswear vibe to any outfit. Vests are a great, genderless way to add style to your basic pieces, especially for work.Layer a vest over a plain or printed top and pair it with neutral pants and boots. Add a watch to complete the look.

steps.title: Choose a blazer for a more androgynous style.
steps.content: Choose a blazer for a more androgynous style. Look for old-school men’s suits – like double-breasted jackets – that have been recut to fit women’s bodies to get the best fit, recommends Gruber. Pick a blazer in a fun print and layer it over a plain shirt. Add boot-cut jeans and a canvas sneaker to keep it casual, or pair it with black pants and Oxfords for a dressier look. Try a blazer in a neutral color, like navy, to pair with bold or printed tops and bottoms. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wear fabrics traditionally used in masculine clothing.
steps.content: Wear fabrics traditionally used in masculine clothing. To dress more like a guy , choose some items in traditionally masculine fabrics, like tweed, corduroy, or leather. [5] X Research source Fabrics that are a bit heavier, more structured, and don’t conform to the shape of your body will help you complete your androgynous look.

steps.title: Wear fitted bottoms, which are more common in women’s fashion.
steps.content: Wear fitted bottoms, which are more common in women’s fashion. One way to dress more androgynously is to choose pieces that add elements of women’s fashion. [6] X Research source Rather than opting for baggy pants, choose a more fitted bottom. Choose skinny jeans or well-fitted dress pants. Wear a cardigan over a t-shirt paired with skinny jeans and canvas sneakers for an everyday androgynous look.

steps.title: Try harem trousers for a more gender-bending look.
steps.content: Try harem trousers for a more gender-bending look. Harem trousers have a partial skirt around the waist and taper toward the ankle. It’s a way of blending masculine and feminine elements, which is key to an androgynous look. [7] X Research source If you’re ready for a bold look, try pairing harem trousers with a fitted button-up shirt.

steps.title: Choose tailored or cropped tops to amp up your gender-bending style.
steps.content: Choose tailored or cropped tops to amp up your gender-bending style. Fitted and cropped tops that expose your midriff are great for masculine-looking people who want the androgynous look. [8] X Research source Rather than wearing a loose t-shirt, pair a tailored top with your favorite jeans to look more feminine . Add canvas sneakers or oxfords to complete the look.

steps.title: Wear a blouse for a hint of feminine fashion.
steps.content: Wear a blouse for a hint of feminine fashion. Blouses are flowy tops that may be gathered at the waist or hips. They are often sheer or made from fabrics like linen or satin. It’s not as uncommon as it once was for men to wear blouses, and even Gucci recently developed a line of men’s blouses. Pair a blouse in a bold color with fitted pants in a neutral tone. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Add a floral print to break gender clothing stereotypes.
steps.content: Add a floral print to break gender clothing stereotypes. A floral print can add a feminine touch to your overall look. You can wear floral pants with a white button-down or pair corduroy pants with a floral top. Finish the look with a portfolio or briefcase and a great watch. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Wear feminine fabrics for a subtle androgynous vibe.
steps.content: Wear feminine fabrics for a subtle androgynous vibe. Choose items made from traditionally feminine fabrics, such as lace, silk, satin, and velvet. Pair a velvet blazer with skinny jeans and canvas sneakers, or dress it up with fitted black pants and oxfords.

steps.title: Add a leather belt to emphasize your gender-neutral style.
steps.content: Add a leather belt to emphasize your gender-neutral style. Gruber recommends buying belts in the men’s section to add a more masculine touch to your wardrobe. Try thinner women’s belts to add feminine energy to your gender-neutral outfits . Choose a leather belt in black or brown for a versatile, chic accessory. Wear it in the traditional style, or sling it low around your hips. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Invest in a pair of oxfords for formal attire.
steps.content: Invest in a pair of oxfords for formal attire. Gruber says a good pair of oxfords is an androgynous staple because it’s typically worn by both feminine- and masculine-looking people. Pick a pair in brown or black, and wear them with jeans or dress pants. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Wear canvas sneakers for a casual look.
steps.content: Wear canvas sneakers for a casual look. Try canvas sneakers with nearly any outfit. Get two pairs, one in a neutral color and one in a fun print or with a bit of bling, so you have a pair to coordinate with any outfit. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Add a hat for the perfect gender-neutral accessory.
steps.content: Add a hat for the perfect gender-neutral accessory. You can go for a fedora , newsboy cap , trapper, or even a baseball hat. Try wearing a newsboy cap with a button-up, jeans, and oxfords. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Wear a watch that challenges gender norms.
steps.content: Wear a watch that challenges gender norms. As a more feminine-looking person, choose a bold, chunky, metallic men’s watch to compliment your androgynous look. Pick one with a bit of bling, or stick to a simple style. Alternatively, choose a wooden watch for a trendy but natural look. Roll up the sleeves on your button-up or cardigan to show off your watch. [15] X Research source Pick a smaller, more delicate women’s watch to add more of a gender-neutral feel if you look more masculine.

steps.title: Choose a portfolio or briefcase as a gender-bending piece.
steps.content: Choose a portfolio or briefcase as a gender-bending piece. As far as bags go, a portfolio – a combination of a briefcase and a purse – is the perfect mix of feminine and masculine. Choose a leather portfolio in a neutral color like black or brown so you can use it every day. Alternatively, choose a briefcase in a fun fabric, such as suede, or a bold color or pattern.

steps.title: Use foundation and concealer minimally.
steps.content: Use foundation and concealer minimally. Use matte powder to create a natural look and hide blemishes. Avoid adding a full face of foundation or bright eyeshadow or lipstick. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Go for a bold brow.
steps.content: Go for a bold brow. People with features traditionally thought of as masculine can tweeze their eyebrows for a more feminine shape. People with features traditionally thought of as feminine should allow their brows to grow out naturally or brush their brows upward for a bushier, boyish look. Fill in your brows, but stick to their natural shape. Concentrate on the outer ends of your brows. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Choose neutral eye shadow.
steps.content: Choose neutral eye shadow. A neutral eye shadow can help blur the gender lines. Choose a neutral color of matte shadow or amp up your look with a glossy shadow in a color close to your skin tone. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Add eyeliner to make your eyes pop.
steps.content: Add eyeliner to make your eyes pop. Apply eyeliner to either the top lid or the top and bottom lids. Avoid flicking the liner at the corners of your eyes for the cat-eye look, which is traditionally feminine. Choose liquid eyeliner for a bold look and pencil eyeliner or dark eyeshadow for a more subtle look. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Wear a neutral lip gloss or lipstick.
steps.content: Wear a neutral lip gloss or lipstick. Glossy, subtle lips are a great way to get an androgynous look. Swipe on a clear gloss or choose a rosy gloss to add some color. You can also wear a “your lips but better” lipstick color that matches your natural lip color for a truly neutral look. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Play up your masculine features if you have traditionally feminine features.
steps.content: Play up your masculine features if you have traditionally feminine features. A chiseled jaw is often seen as a masculine feature. Sweep a matte bronzer along your jawline to add definition. [21] X Research source Avoid highlighting traditionally feminine features, such as high cheekbones.

steps.title: Play up your feminine features if you have traditionally masculine features.
steps.content: Play up your feminine features if you have traditionally masculine features. Highlight your cheekbones with a shimmery blush . Experiment with applying contour to create a slender neck and less-defined jawline. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Chop off your locks for a more androgynous style.
steps.content: Chop off your locks for a more androgynous style. Though you don’t have to have short hair to get the androgynous look, you may want to go all in. Consider a pixie cut or even a buzz cut or a shaved head. [23] X Research source

steps.title: Slick your hair back.
steps.content: Slick your hair back. Slicked-back hair can ramp up the edginess of your look. Use gel or pomade to create a sleek and shiny style. A slicked-back grown-out pixie cuts look especially chic. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Wear a curly mohawk.
steps.content: Wear a curly mohawk. Your hair doesn’t need to be short or slick for an androgynous look. Embrace your curls and add a bit of edginess to your look by styling your locks into a faux-hawk . You can also shave the sides of your head for a true mohawk.

steps.title: Try the shag look.
steps.content: Try the shag look. Androgynous icon Joan Jett was famous for her shaggy hairstyle. Both men and women can embrace the shag look. As a bonus, it’s a versatile, low-maintenance style that you’re likely to love.

steps.title: Color your locks.
steps.content: Color your locks. Don’t be afraid to add a pop of color to your look by tinting your hair. Add subtle highlights or go for a bold color like purple. Experiment with different options to see which you like best.
